page.title: 20GOLDINGTON GREEN CHURCH
page.content:
{St. Mary the Virgin, Goldington}
The church dates back to the thirteenth century with major additions in the fourteenth, fifteenth and nineteenth centuries. Several local events are organised there, such as the fete and the flower festival. There are also numerous groups that meet on a regular basis such as The Mother and Toddlers group, The Drama group, The Bible Reading Fellowship and several groups for men, for women and for young people. These groups strive not only to bring people together but also to deal with their religious and social concerns. The church acts as a focal point around which such activities can be organised and together with its role as a centre of religion forms an indispensable part of the community.
